Squeeze & Exhaustion Risk Indicators

CoT tactical squeeze and exhaustion risk signals.

As of 2025-12-23

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Squeeze & Exhaustion Breadth signal currently indicates Normal tactical risk for both squeeze and exhaustion conditions, as of 2025-12-23 (1). This reflects stable, non-extreme tactical risk levels across futures markets.
  • Conviction Band: Low | Interpretation Confidence: High Confidence | Internal Conflict Flag: No.

Key Dynamics:

  • Both the Squeeze_z (-0.068677) and Exhaustion_z (-0.565736) values for 2025-12-23 are well within the "Normal" regime thresholds (1).
  • This indicates a stabilisation in cross-market tactical risks at typical historical levels.
  • Conditional Invalidation: The signal would reverse if either Squeeze_z or Exhaustion_z rises above 0.5, signalling at least "Moderate Squeeze Risk" or "Moderate Exhaustion Risk" (1).

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: Tactical risks remain "Normal" for both squeezes and exhaustion, supported by current z-scores below 0.5 (1).
  • Upside secondary: A renewed surge in speculative positioning or trend persistence could elevate squeeze or exhaustion risks to moderate levels.
  • Downside residual: Continued absence of widespread tactical risks, potentially leading to even lower z-scores, although not an explicit regime.

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Tactical (weeks), as this signal aggregates market-level tactical flags (1).
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: Low, given the current "Normal" regime and its tactical nature, indicating no immediate widespread risk.

Macro Relevance:

  • Macro dimension informed: Sentiment, specifically market fragility and trend conviction (1).
  • Cycle position: Not directly indicative of a macro cycle position, but rather tactical market dynamics.
  • Typical interaction with other macro signals: Used as a tactical overlay alongside volatility, liquidity, and positioning composites to gauge overall market risk sentiment (1).

Data & References:

  • df_cot_signals: Latest observation 2025-12-23, providing `squeeze_count` (14) and `exhaustion_count` (15) across 352 markets.
  • The `Squeeze_z` of -0.068677 and `Exhaustion_z` of -0.565736 are most influential for the current "Normal" regime classification (1).
  • Additional public datasets that would improve depth or reliability: VIX (Market Volatility Signal (2)), and Cross-Sector Positioning (3).
